unnormalised: Obstetrics and Gynecology, or Obs-Gyn as some call it, is a branch of medicine focused on women’s health, particularly related to pregnancy, childbirth, and the reproductive system. It’s a pretty vital field, you see lots of lady doctors specializing in it these days. The field covers everything from routine check-ups to managing complex pregnancies and performing surgeries. In India, with our diverse population and varying access to healthcare, it's especially important.
normalised: Obstetrics and Gynecology, or O-b-s G-y-n as some call it, is a branch of medicine focused on women’s health, particularly related to pregnancy, childbirth, and the reproductive system. It’s a pretty vital field, you see lots of lady doctors specializing in it these days. The field covers everything from routine check-ups to managing complex pregnancies and performing surgeries. In India, with our diverse population and varying access to healthcare, it's especially important.

unnormalised: Thinking about having a baby? Prenatal care is a big part of what an Obs-Gyn does. They monitor the health of both the mother and the baby throughout the pregnancy, usually from around the 8th week. They’ll order ultrasounds to check on the baby's development, advise on diet and lifestyle, and screen for potential complications like gestational diabetes or pre-eclampsia. They'll also explain things like delivery options – normal delivery, C-section, or even water birth if that's your jam. A normal delivery at a private hospital in Mumbai can cost anywhere from Rs. 50,000 to Rs. 1 lakh, depending on the facilities and the doctor's fees.
normalised: Thinking about having a baby? Prenatal care is a big part of what an O-b-s G-y-n does. They monitor the health of both the mother and the baby throughout the pregnancy, usually from around the eighth week. They’ll order ultrasounds to check on the baby's development, advise on diet and lifestyle, and screen for potential complications like gestational diabetes or pre-eclampsia. They'll also explain things like delivery options – normal delivery, C-section, or even water birth if that's your jam. A normal delivery at a private hospital in Mumbai can cost anywhere from rupees fifty thousand to rupees one lakh, depending on the facilities and the doctor's fees.

unnormalised: Childbirth itself is a big event, and the Obs-Gyn plays a central role. They'll be there to guide you through labor, manage any complications that arise, and deliver the baby safely. They can also perform episiotomies if needed. And after the baby arrives, they provide postpartum care for the mother, monitoring her recovery and helping with breastfeeding. Don't hesitate to ask them anything; they've seen it all!
normalised: Childbirth itself is a big event, and the O-b-s G-y-n plays a central role. They'll be there to guide you through labor, manage any complications that arise, and deliver the baby safely. They can also perform episiotomies if needed. And after the baby arrives, they provide postpartum care for the mother, monitoring her recovery and helping with breastfeeding. Don't hesitate to ask them anything; they've seen it all!

unnormalised: Besides pregnancy, Obs-Gyns also deal with a wide range of other women’s health issues. This includes menstrual problems, such as heavy bleeding (menorrhagia) or painful periods (dysmenorrhea). They also diagnose and treat infections like UTIs and STIs. For example, a common prescription for UTI is usually a course of antibiotics taken over 5-7 days. They also handle issues related to menopause, such as hormone replacement therapy (HRT).
normalised: Besides pregnancy, O-b-s G-y-n-s also deal with a wide range of other women’s health issues. This includes menstrual problems, such as heavy bleeding (menorrhagia) or painful periods (dysmenorrhea). They also diagnose and treat infections like U-T-I-s and S-T-I-s. For example, a common prescription for U-T-I is usually a course of antibiotics taken over five to seven days. They also handle issues related to menopause, such as hormone replacement therapy (H-R-T).

unnormalised: Many Obs-Gyns also perform surgeries. This can include things like hysterectomies (removal of the uterus), myomectomies (removal of fibroids), and ovarian cystectomies (removal of ovarian cysts). They also do laparoscopies, a minimally invasive surgical technique used to diagnose and treat various conditions. Dr. Anjali Mehra at AIIMS, Delhi, is a well-known surgeon in this field and performs over 200 surgeries a year.
normalised: Many O-b-s G-y-n-s also perform surgeries. This can include things like hysterectomies (removal of the uterus), myomectomies (removal of fibroids), and ovarian cystectomies (removal of ovarian cysts). They also do laparoscopies, a minimally invasive surgical technique used to diagnose and treat various conditions. Doctor Anjali Mehra at A-I-I-M-S, Delhi, is a well-known surgeon in this field and performs over two hundred surgeries a year.

unnormalised: Basically, an Obs-Gyn is your go-to doctor for all things related to women’s health. From your first period to menopause and beyond, they’re there to support you and help you stay healthy. Finding a good Obs-Gyn, preferably one recommended by a friend or family member, is a good first step toward prioritizing your well-being. Remember to schedule regular check-ups!
normalised: Basically, an O-b-s G-y-n is your go-to doctor for all things related to women’s health.
